sentences.english: There are many English idioms that can not be rendered into other languages.
sentences.chinese: 有很多英語習語很難譯爲別種語言。

sentences.english: This informal idiom for proposing marriage has been in use since 1826.
sentences.chinese: 這個表示求婚的非正式習語從1826年就開始使用。

sentences.english: Idioms are some unique long-term use of phrases and sentences fixed.
sentences.chinese: 習語是人們長期使用的一些獨特的固定短語和短句。

sentences.english: Idioms are the elite of carious language, influenced by the cultural factors .
sentences.chinese: 習語是語言文化中的精華，而且受文化因素的影響。

sentences.english: When  studying a foreign language, idioms are often the most difficult thing to learn.
sentences.chinese: 學習外語時，習語常是其中最難學的部分。

sentences.english: Some idioms will be international in use.
sentences.chinese: 一些習語可在國際上通用。

sentences.english: He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 他反覆推敲一個習語以使該句增色。

sentences.english: The Singleton creation pattern is a common programming idiom.
sentences.chinese: 單例創建模式是一個通用的編程習語。

sentences.english: Even characters in historical or fantastical novels would have them.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連歷史人物或者幻想小說中的人物都用習語。

sentences.english: This article will discuss the idioms and their inflected culture.
sentences.chinese: 此文章將通過習語來源討論其反映的文化。

sentences.english: A party pooper is someone who (always) ruins the fun.
sentences.chinese: 這個習語指的是總是在派對上掃人興的人。

sentences.english: This paper deals with the relevance of idiolect to translation.
sentences.chinese: 本文論述了個人習語與翻譯兩者之間的關係。

sentences.english: Remember that annoying “Out of your league” expression? As in, “Don’t even try it, man.
sentences.chinese: 記得那個煩人的“想喫天鵝肉”習語嗎？

sentences.english: Idioms exist in all languages. They are, however, especially common in spoken American English.
sentences.chinese: 習語存在於所有語言，但在美國英語口語中尤其常見。

sentences.english: Idioms are crystallizations of a nation′s wisdom and the cram of its language.
sentences.chinese: 習語是一個民族智慧的結晶，是語言中的精華。

sentences.english: You must also know some important “Strine” English terminology.
sentences.chinese: 你必須瞭解一些澳大利亞英語的習語。

definition: to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
